The FAANGs—a basket of high-growth technology companies that includes Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, and Alphabet—have lost $1.1 trillion since their peaks.

It wasn’t long ago that investors were placing odds on the first U.S. stock to reach a trillion-dollar market value.
Amazon.com followed suit, though its trillion-dollar dalliance lasted less than a day.
Apple won the race, crossing the symbolic mark in early August.
For most tech stocks, it has been downhill ever since.
Now the talk is about a trillion-dollar meltdown.
This month alone, the loss comes to $400 billion.
